data.title: 以至少 50 个字回答问题
data.content: "Some people trust their first impressions of other people, while others try not to judge too quickly. Which attitude do you agree with most? Why? Give specific reasons for your answer."
data.answer: The debate over first impressions has always intrigued people. Personally, I believe in first impressions. When we meet someone for the first time, we make judgments about their trustworthiness and competence in a fraction of a second. We do this based on a variety of clues, including physical appearance, facial characteristics, posture, gestures, attire, and so on.  This makes sense from an evolutionary perspective. We are visual creatures. When we meet a stranger, we tend to assess them by their overall look, including their physical appearance and attire. One’s physical appearance somewhat indicates his or her personality, while one’s attire tells us his or her taste and social-economic class, which in turn implies his or her competence. （121 字）
